abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is assessed as
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely, with substantial
            institutional development impacts. Key lessons address: 1)
            general aspects on design, which particularly in transition
            economies, should focus on realistic project objectives; on
            the need for monitoring indicators to measure effectiveness;
            on monitoring real policy development; and, on careful
            consideration of regional partnerships, particularly under
            fiscal constraints, to define adequate investment levels; 2)
            employment aspects, calling for a revision to the legal
            framework in order to address labor relations, and the
            provision of employment services; and, for a properly
            administered replication system, mainly through significant
            will, and complementary infrastructure for staff
            development; 3) social aspects, specifically on the balance
            of investments, identifying the need to go beyond benefit
            administration, and statistical analysis, in an attempt to
            optimize social protection policy, and modernize
            institutional arrangements, to include resource planning; on
            information technology processes, procedures, and
            procurement, to achieve uniformity, define the needs to be
            supported by technical staffs, and, strengthen procurement
            requirements; and, 4) project management aspects,
            particularly the need for a strong project unit to
            coordinate information exchange, financing and payment of
            taxes, and, decentralization of customs clearance.
